Package game.monsters

Class Monster

java.lang.Object
game.monsters.Monster
All Implemented Interfaces:
Purchaseable
Direct Known Subclasses:
DebuffMonster, FlyingMonster, PoisonMonster, RiskyMonster
public class Monster extends Object implements Purchaseable
Monster is the base class for any monster types, it is responsible for the monsters current status, including health, damage, level, xp, whether the monster is fainted or awake, and temporary status effects. The class also contains the behaviour for the monsters attacks against other monsters and making random attacks, as well as other needed behaviours such as levelling up and resting. Monster also implements Purchaseable, as Monsters can be bought in the shop.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Monster(String name, int startLevel)
    Constructs the Monster, setting the name, level, and then the initial damage, maxHealth and price based on that level.

  • Constructor Details

    • Monster

      public Monster(String name, int startLevel)
      Constructs the Monster, setting the name, level, and then the initial damage, maxHealth and price based on that level. Also initializes ArrayList's like persitenDamage and initializes the xp to 0.
      Parameters:
      name - The monster's name.
      startLevel - The level this monster starts at (should be between 0 and 24 but is set as such if out of range).

  • Method Details

    • getRandomName

      public static String getRandomName()
      A static method generating a random name using the descriptives and types arrays.
      Returns:
      A random name for this type of monster.

    • setWasActiveDuringBattle

      public void setWasActiveDuringBattle(boolean newBool)
      Simple setter for wasActiveDuringBattle
      Parameters:
      newBool - the new value of wasActiveDuringBattle

    • reward

      public void reward()
      Rewards the monster with xp based on the value of wasActiveDuringBattle, using rewardXP and passiveXP, should be called only after battles.

    • levelUpCheck

      public String levelUpCheck()
      Checks if there is sufficient xp to reach the next level, and if so sets xp back to zero, increases the level (if not at maxLevel), and increases damage, maxHealth, and price accordingly.
      Returns:
      null if no level up occurs, else a string describing the level up and new damage and maxHealth values.

    • getName

      public String getName()
      Simple getter for the monster's name.
      Specified by:
      getName in interface Purchaseable
      Returns:
      The name of this object.

    • setName

      public void setName(String newName)
      Simple setter for the monster's name.
      Parameters:
      newName - the new name of the monster.

    • getDamage

      public int getDamage()
      Get's the monster's base damage, this should only be used for display purpases as for attacks the getTotalDamage() function should be used.
      Returns:
      the base damage of the monster.

    • getMaxHealth

      public int getMaxHealth()
      Simple getter for maxHeatlh.
      Returns:
      the maxHealth of the monster.

    • getHealth

      public int getHealth()
      Simple getter for the monster's current health.
      Returns:
      the monster's current health

    • getPrice

      public int getPrice()
      The monster's buy price.
      Specified by:
      getPrice in interface Purchaseable
      Returns:
      An integer price value.

    • getSellPrice

      public int getSellPrice()
      The monster's sell price, which is half of it's regular price.
      Specified by:
      getSellPrice in interface Purchaseable
      Returns:
      An integer sell price value.

    • getAttackStrings

      public ArrayList<String> getAttackStrings()
      Returns the names of the monster's attacks in an ArrayList, for display and player input purpases.
      Returns:
      the ArrayList of attack name strings.

    • addDamageBuff

      public void addDamageBuff(int dam, int dur)
      Adds a damage buff to this monster, taking a damage amount and duration.
      Parameters:
      dam - The increase or decrease in damage for this buff.
      dur - The duration in turns of this buff.

    • getTotalDamage

      public int getTotalDamage()
      Gets the total damage of this monster, accounting for the base damage and any buffs. This is the function that should be used for all attacks.
      Returns:
      The total damage of this monster.

    • dealDamageToSelf

      public String dealDamageToSelf(int damageDealt)
      Deals damage to this monster, rendering them fainted if health goes to 0 or below, returns a message summarising the effects.
      Parameters:
      damageDealt - The damage to deal to this monster.
      Returns:
      A string describing the effects of the damage (damage increase and if fainted it describes the faint).

    • dealPersistentDamageToSelf

      public String dealPersistentDamageToSelf(int damageDealtPerTurn, int duration)
      Adds a persistent damage attack to this monster, to be dealt at the start of each turn for a certain duration.
      Parameters:
      damageDealtPerTurn - The damage to deal per turn.
      duration - The duration for which this attack lasts.
      Returns:
      A string describing the attack.

    • heal

      public void heal(int healAmount)
      Heals by a certain amount.
      Parameters:
      healAmount - The amount to heal by.

    • isAwake

      public boolean isAwake()
      Returns if the monster is awake or not.
      Returns:
      Whether or not the monster is awake.

    • preTurnLogic

      public ArrayList<String> preTurnLogic()
      Carries out necersary logic to perform before a turn, such as dealing persistent damage, and removing damage buffs and persitent damage attacks that have run out of duration. More actions may be performed by subclass monsters.
      Returns:
      An ArrayList of String messages summarising the actions performed.

    • makeMove

      public String makeMove(int move, Monster enemy)
      Makes a move based on an int move, for the base Monster class there is only one move, 0, which is a basic attack.
      Parameters:
      move - The move to perform (should be an index of attack strings)
      enemy - The enemy Monster to perform the move against.
      Returns:
      A message string summarising the move for display purpases.

    • makeRandomMove

      public String makeRandomMove(Monster enemy)
      Same as makeMove, but makes a random move instead of taking a move integer to determine the move. Used for the non player monsters.
      Parameters:
      enemy - The enemy Monster

    • resetStatusEffects

      public void resetStatusEffects()
      Resets all status effects by clearing the damage buffs and persitent damage attacks. Some subclass monsters may overide this method.

    • rest

      public void rest()
      Sets health to max, sets the monster to awake and removes any status effects.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      String representation of the monster, including name, health/maxHealth, totalDamage/baseDamage, level and whether the monster is awake.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object

    • basicStr

      public String basicStr()
      Like to string but with only the most basic info.
      Returns:
      A basic String representation of Monster.
